> [kickasstorrents](#comment_6_1D6Pn4487L8QyFtVSU14nxxtnfEgEs2Ny1): If you're interested, what would be really helpful is if we could clone something like TheTVDB or TheMovieDB or even go crazy and build something like Trakt.

Further down the road, yeah, that it definitely something to strive for, TheMovieDB has an API so pulling data should be a cinch. I think right now we need to focus on getting a basic zite up and running with the just the bare essentials, proof-of-concept if you will, demonstrate that this whole crazy thing can actually work. 

> [kickasstorrents](#comment_6_1D6Pn4487L8QyFtVSU14nxxtnfEgEs2Ny1):  We need a system of some sort for metadata about a particular torrent. This metadata would of course be different depending on the torrent and it's category but is ultimately what would provide a summary, actors information, IMDB ratings, posters, etc...

What about size limits? Not sure exactly how that works but apparently there's a quota that cuts off after its reached, need to disable that if metadata is going to be submitted.

OK, so I've just dumped around 100 movie titles into ZeroTorrent to feel things out, so far so good. I included the hash info in the decription in case people want to search by that parameter. No quota cap reached yet. Using Magnetissimo would probably be more efficient, as would a more clear division of labor, one group harvesting the data while another inserts it. But yeah, this is definitely doable!

Its nearly half used up now, I musta dumped like 1500 movie titles on there this morning. But eventually it'll all add up, local storage is going to be the major issue with any data-heavy zite, especially a endlessly expanding torrent indexer, a dedicated hard drive will become necessary at some point in time. But I have a few ideas about how to mitigate that.

Regarding spam, that would be the MAFIAAs only recourse, hire a botnet and bombard the network with junk submissions, akin to the torrent and index poisoning of years gone by. So there needs to be a way of blocking specific IP ranges and blacklisting rogue users, standard stuff.

> [tkarita](#comment_87_1GervYZoP82e8X1Rgc4wyMkJY2zSsJuq8t): Users can be blacklisted, but it's easy to get new usernames.  Since ZeroNet encourages use of Tor, IP bans wouldn't be effective.

Oh yeah, thats right.......so the only viable option is user classes. Brand new users are put on probation with a fixed posting quota until such time they are promoted to regular/trusted members, clearnet forums do that all the time. Its not perfect but it'll do the job.
with no admin around ZeroTorrent is really just a dumping ground useful for field testing, the long-term solution is going to be something bigger and better.
